result.execSummary:
The defendant Kale R Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kale R Stewart in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Kale R Stewart in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schmidt moves the court to adjourn the matter so Stewart can prepare for sentence.  Court orders cash bond of $10,000 cash bond on case that already has a cash bond.  Bond is converted to $10,000 cash.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.

10:02 a.m  Defendant Kale R Stewart in court, 10:06 he arrived, with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court gives his oral ruling on a number of motions regarding cross referenced cases.  Motion to suppress evidence is reviewed and Court denies.  Court reviews the motions regarding the backpack, miranda rights and searches.  Court denies the motions of the defendant on these points.  Attorney Schmidt requests a pre trial conference
Oral ruling on August 25, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement

2:32 Defendant Kale R Stewart in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty Kurczewski proceeds initially with motion in 15CM467.  Brad Burris is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Wisconsin Rapids Police Dept.  Testifies to being on duty 07/04/15 on bike patrol.  Describes going down alleyway behind Big Al's Bar and observing a male individual smoking marihuana in a group of other males.  Testifies to identifying the males.  Identifies Kale Stewart in the courtroom.  Testifies to Kale being arrested at that time for a probation hold.  Testifies to his report regarding the incident.  Atty Kurczewski allows Officer Burris to review his report.  Testifies to a male indicating that a backpack found in area belonged to Kale Stewart.

Atty Schmidt cross examines the witness.  Testifies to backpack.  Did not read Stewart his Miranda Rights.  Testifies to where backpack was located.  Believes he arrested Stewart for Nekoosa warrants.  

Scott Dewitt is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to employment with Wis Rapids Police Dept.  Heard Officer Burris' testimony and was on same bike patrol on 07/04/2016.  Testifies to how he came in contact with Kale Stewart.  Stewart was handed off to him by Burris after he was placed under arrest.  Testifies to backpack found and to asking Stewart if backpack was his.  Testifies to his practice regarding search of property.  Steward indicated he was carrying backpack for a friend.  Testifies to how it was determined that backpack was Stewart's.  Testifies to items found in back pack.

Atty Schmidt cross examines the witness.  Did not read Stewart his Miranda Rights and never saw Stewart wearing the backpack.  

Atty Kurczewski presents argument.  Atty Schmidt argues.  Court questions Atty Schmidt.  Court grants the motion to suppress.  Court denies the motion in respect to other motion.
of Karl A. Schmidt
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence
